subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In {{w|traditional Chinese}} (Taiwan and Hong Kong), the right component is written <big>{{l|mul|茲}}</big> (contains {{l|mul|艹}}), which is the orthodox form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In {{w|simplified Chinese}} (mainland China), the right component is written <big>{{l|mul|兹}}</big> (contains {{l|mul|䒑}}), which is also a historical {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant}} found in {{w|classical Chinese}} dictionaries.
* In Japanese {{w|kanji}}, the right component is written <big>{{l|mul|玆}}</big> (duplication of {{l|mul|玄}}).
* Due to {{w|Han unification}}, the three forms above are encoded under the same [[code point]]. This character will appear differently depending on the font used.
